assignments.name: query
assignments.value: ={{ $json.topic }} ((-filter:replies min_retweets:2 min_faves:30) OR (filter:self_threads min_faves:15)) lang:en -spam -promotional -"follow me" -bot -"dm me" -"link in bio" within_time:24h

json.tweet_text:
Newgen is a classic example where a product gets into a higher orbit once it achieves the critical mass. It has very clearly repositioned itself from the edge of business to "at the core". 

There are many process automation tools available - both enterprise & non-enterprise. N8N being most popular in non-enterprise space and then within enterprise software, OEMs have their own process automation platforms. 

Where companies like Newgen gets the edge is not with the tech, but the years of insights of how to use underlying data and where to provision embedded AI capabilities. Launching agentic services becomes as easy as adding 2+2 eventually. All the hard-work that was done between 2020-2023 has culminated into something that has its own standing. Those who could envision ahead in time are the winners!! What a winner.

🚀 AUTOMATE Your Socials — FREE GUIDE🚀

Post to LinkedIn, X, IG, FB & more — hands-free with AI + n8n ⚙️

🎁 Get the full workflow + setup visual FREE!

To claim:👇

1️⃣ Like ❤️
2️⃣ Retweet 🔁
3️⃣ Comment “AUTO”
4️⃣ Follow (for DM)

⏳ First 100 only — act fast! https://t.co/ETShc437gn

🔥 Automate Your Entire Social Media in 1 Click with AI + N8N

No more posting manually across platforms.

This AI-powered workflow writes, designs, and schedules viral content for LinkedIn, Instagram, X, Facebook & more — all from one dashboard.

✅ GPT-4o generates platform-specific posts
✅ Auto-scheduling across all social channels
✅ Custom hooks, captions & hashtags
✅ Google Sheets integration for tracking
✅ Fully automated – just plug & run

Perfect for creators, agencies, and brands scaling fast.

Retweet + Like+ Comment “Agent”. Must Follow so I’ll DM you.

🚨 BREAKING: I just cracked the code on FREE leads! 🔥

This N8N + AI combo is INSANE! 😱

500 leads in seconds? ✅ 
Costs 41 cents? ✅ 
AI writes emails? ✅

Google Maps, LinkedIn, Instagram - it scrapes EVERYTHING! 🤖

My exact template? Link below! 👇 https://t.co/qY4ZGiB1lz

The 12 Rules for n8n

Agents, Webhooks, Integrations, HTTP Requests

And More https://t.co/ugvToHlWjL

I just scraped 50 local dentists in 60 seconds.

No coding, no expensive tools—completely FREE 🎯

THE EXACT PROCESS:

1️⃣ Set up N8N HTTP request (POST method)
2️⃣ Connect Apify's Google Maps scraper
3️⃣ Configure search terms + location filters
4️⃣ Auto-map data to Google Sheets
5️⃣ Generate AI-powered outreach emails

Results: Complete lead database with phone numbers, emails, and addresses in minutes.

Save this post, it will save you thousands on lead gen tools 💡

Want the full guide? DM me. 📥

Software engineers are F%$#&D

I just made this FULLY working app in 30 minutes and closing in on $10K MRR using Vibecode and n8n.

This simple landscaping app tracks customer appointments, billing, and support for both the owner and clients. I've closed on 4 clients so far.

Let me know if you guys want to see a tutorial!

SWE ngmi

n8n Complete Beginners Guide

Agents, Webhooks, Integrations, HTTP Requests...

And more.

I just sent out this week's "5 freeCodeCamp resources worth your time" 🏗️. Some heaters in here including a 2-hour course on agentic "vibe coding" with n8n and a soil moisture Arduino project.

1. freeCodeCamp just published this comprehensive course that will teach you how to build apps using the LAMP Stack – Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP. This is a classic toolchain that a huge number of websites still use to this day. You can code along at home and build your own clone of Google Calendar – complete with multi-appointment support and booking conflict logic. Then you'll use JavaScript to add a dynamic user interface. This project will help you expand your horizons and get in some serious reps. (3 hour YouTube course): https://t.co/jnnOwXDWTh

2. You may have heard the term “vibe coding”, where you write the specifications for your app, then hand it over to code generation agents who write the code for you. This approach has been a bit polarizing in the developer community, with vocal critics and vocal advocates. My advice is don't listen to any of them. Think for yourself. freeCodeCamp just published this course that will introduce you to vibe coding tools like n8n – an open source workflow automation tool – so you can wire together APIs and services without needing to write a ton of code manually. (2 hour YouTube course): https://t.co/13mWijnYmg

3. On this week's podcast I interview Joe Hill. He's a software engineer who works on a data platform for NASA. Joe taught himself programming for 4 years while working as a janitor. As the single father of two Autistic boys, he first used his programming skills to build an iPad app to help them learn how to talk. He shares tons of practical tips for learning new skills and for getting things done inside big orgs. (1 hour watch or listen in your favorite podcast app): https://t.co/oxl8ZItGZV

4. Learn how to write Python tests so you can make your codebase more robust. This tutorial will teach you the basics of pytest and show you tons of examples. You'll learn about Markers, Fixtures, Parameterization, and more. (20 minute read): https://t.co/a3yi9SY3zJ

5. Tell your gardener friends: freeCodeCamp just published a tutorial on how to monitor the moisture of your soil using an Arduino microcontroller. This tutorial will show you what hardware to get and how to wire it up. Then it'll walk you through the code you'll run, and explain how everything works. (30 minute read): https://t.co/QLWSxd6a9N

The freeCodeCamp community is working hard to bring you new courses each week on pretty much everything. If you want to help our charity create even more open source learning resources, you should support our mission directly: https://t.co/PJXlqTfPxH

Quote of the Week: 
“Becoming tool agnostic is one of the biggest strengths you will ever have as a programmer. If you walk into a place and they say “we use XYZ”, you can go “Great. I'll learn it.” That is so powerful.” — Software Engineer Joe Hill on this week's freeCodeCamp podcast

the n8n automation ecosystem if FULL of fake gurus...

they can't show you how to build workflows because most of them are STOLEN, and they certainly can't teach you how to find clients

here's a blueprint to go from $0 to $10k/mo selling n8n workflows:

a thread 🧵

All of these can be setup within 60 MINS and SAVE you 10+ HOURS per week.

Easily worth $997+
Today It's yours for FREE

👉RT + Like & Comment “n8n” and I’ll DM you the file
(Must be following) https://t.co/JEZp1QRA6r

I just finished setting up an AI Agent that processes 100+ client documents daily for agencies, SaaS and ecom businesses (in n8n)

It extracts data, sends emails, and handles document workflows without the need to do it manually

Complete AI automation that saves 35+ hours/week on client paperwork

You can also use it for reporting of any type

- Auto-extracts text from PDFs
- Processes multiple file formats
- Sends automated email responses
- Routes documents intelligently

This AI workflow saves $80K+/year in processing costs

Want it FREE?

👉 RT + Like & Comment "WORKFLOW" and I'll DM the JSON file + doc to you ASAP

No opt-in, no BS

(Must follow)

N8N: AI Agent Creation Guide
Create intelligent, memory-driven AI agents using N8N, and connect them with tools like Gmail, Google Calendar, and more

Coupon code is 11JULY2025

https://t.co/bYLi2iTrJT

If I were launching a services business today, here are the 9 tools I'd use to hit $1M in year one:

1/ @n8n_io - Build an AI workforce. Automate proposals, client onboarding, reporting. We saved 20 hours/week on repetitive tasks within month one.

2/ @SpaceChenst - Your outsourced finance department. Real-time P&L by client, cash flow forecasting, and fractional CFO guidance. Know your margins before they know you.

3/ @NotionHQ - Operating system for everything. Client wiki, project tracking, SOPs, team knowledge base. Start with templates, customize as you scale.

4/ @WisprFlow - Dictate proposals/emails/anything 3x faster than typing. Perfect for busy founders.

5/ @useMotion - Calendar that thinks. Auto-schedules tasks around client meetings, ensures nothing drops. Like having an EA before you can afford one.

6/ @TallyForms - Beautiful forms with conditional logic, payment collection, and Notion integration. Goodbye, Google Forms.

7/ @Loom - Async communication superpower. Record SOPs once, use forever. Client updates in 2 minutes vs 30-minute calls.

8/ @Mixpanel - Track what matters. Which services drive retention? What's your client LTV? Data-driven decisions from day one.

9/ @Mercury - Banking that scales. Virtual cards for each client project, expense management built-in. Clean books from the start.

What should I add to this list?

I just merged all top n8n automations that help creators earn $10K/month on autopilot.

Can’t believe I’m about to reveal this to everyone.

Check this out:

→ Auto-generates high-converting hooks & captions with ChatGPT
→ Dynamically creates AI images based on your posts (yes, like memes... but juiced)
→ Logs everything — prompts, captions, images, platform info — into a clean Google Sheet (so you look smart)
→ Prepares ready-to-approve HTML email previews for clients or team
→ Routes final posts straight to TikTok, Instagram, LinkedIn, YouTube Shorts, X, Threads (it’s like a content octopus 🐙)
→ Archives every post to Google Drive for future use (hello, content repurposing heaven)

No Zapier. No VA burnout. 

No duct-tape spaghetti mess.

Like + reply “YES” & I’ll send you the FULL workflow + setup FREE!

n8n Complete Beginners Guide

Agents, Webhooks, Integrations, HTTP Requests...

And more.

What a journey. What an experience. On to the next.

Newgen is a classic example where a product gets into a higher orbit once it achieves the critical mass. It has very clearly repositioned itself from the edge of business to "at the core". 

There are many process automation tools available - both enterprise & non-enterprise. N8N being most popular in non-enterprise space and then within enterprise software, OEMs have their own process automation platforms. 

Where companies like Newgen gets the edge is not with the tech, but the years of insights of how to use underlying data and where to provision embedded AI capabilities. Launching agentic services becomes as easy as adding 2+2 eventually. All the hard-work that was done between 2020-2023 has culminated into something that has its own standing. Those who could envision ahead in time are the winners!! What a winner.

the n8n automation ecosystem if FULL of fake gurus...

they can't show you how to build workflows because most of them are STOLEN, and they certainly can't teach you how to find clients

here's a blueprint to go from $0 to $10k/mo selling n8n workflows:

a thread 🧵

(2) here's the exact automation stack that fixes this revenue leak:

- webhook triggers from website forms
- instant SMS with quote estimate + booking link
- 7-day follow-up sequence with social proof videos
- automated scheduling with deposit collection
- review request automation 48 hours post-completion

speed is the killer in local services

(3) moving to e-commerce brands ($1M-$10M revenue)...

they're drowning in customer service tickets while profit margins evaporate

60% of support tickets are repeat questions that kill team productivity

most brands hire their way out... smart builders automate their way out

(4) this e-commerce automation eliminates the support chaos:

- AI-powered ticket classification using OpenAI + sentiment analysis
- instant responses for order status, shipping, returns
- automatic refund processing for qualifying cases
- escalation triggers for high-value customers
- upsell automation during positive support interactions

you can get up to 70% reduction in support workload without a doubt

(5) the third goldmine is early-stage SaaS companies...

they're burning $200K+ on sales team overhead while conversion rates stay flat

80% of qualified leads never get proper follow-up because sales reps focus on "bigger" opportunities

founders think they need more salespeople... they need better automation

(6) this SaaS automation stack converts prospects on autopilot:

- product usage tracking with behavioral scoring
- triggered email sequences based on feature adoption
- automated demo booking with calendar optimization
- objection-handling chatbot with human handoff triggers
- pricing experiment automation with dynamic offer testing

you can get SO MUCH more out of those leads, they're missing out on big money

(7) now... once you've built these workflows, you need clients to buy them

here's the daily lead machine that generates 5-15 qualified leads using psychological triggers that feel personal at scale

context-driven outreach gets 25%+ response rates

anything else is sh*t

(8) but first, you need intel on your prospects...

this research layer separates you from every other n8n seller:

- prospect identification engine with ICP criteria matching
- company news + recent hires + funding events enrichment
- LinkedIn activity scraping for trigger events
- technology stack analysis for pain points
- competitor analysis for positioning opportunities

context = conversion

spend time investing in data collection for your persona, it will pay off

(9) once you have the intel, here's how to turn it into conversations

this 7-day sequence works because it builds trust before asking for anything:

day 1: insight bomb (pure value, no pitch)
day 3: pattern share (industry trend + mini case study)
day 5: resource drop (helpful tool/framework)
day 7: soft ask (low-pressure meeting request)

magic happens between day 3-5

just send this sequence in volume, there is no way you're not generating leads

(10) but getting interest is only half the battle...

most automation stops at "interested prospect", this closing protocol turns interest into contracts:

4-step sequence:
1. discovery intensifier
2. custom solution reveal
3. objection anticipator
4. decision forcer

eliminate "thinking about it" forever

execute this and you will convert every cold prospect into a customer

(11) step 1 is crucial - the discovery intensifier...

send a questionnaire that:
- uncovers specific pain points and quantifies impact
- identifies decision-making process and timeline
- establishes budget parameters without asking directly
- creates urgency through cost-of-inaction calculations

automated follow-up if not completed within 48 hours

(12) every objection should trigger an automated response...

example: "need to think about it"
--> automated response: "what specific aspect needs clarity..."
--> follow-up: case study addressing exact concern
--> escalation: personal video addressing hesitation

no leads slip through cracks when you automate objection handling

(13) after the initial close attempt, this follow-up matrix keeps you top of mind:

week 1: education phase (case studies + ROI calculators)
week 2: social proof phase (testimonials + before/after metrics)
week 3: urgency phase (limited slots + bonus offers)
week 4: final phase ("last chance" + quarterly nurture)

decision point triggers determine next action

(14) throughout this entire process, these psychological triggers do the heavy lifting:

- pattern interrupt: "you're absolutely right to think that..."
- authority transfer: "our most successful clients initially had the same concern..."
- future pacing: "imagine 6 months from now when this problem is solved..."
- loss aversion: "cost of waiting typically exceeds implementation cost by 3x..."

psychology > perfect scripts

(15) running all of this requires the right tech foundation...

core tools:
- n8n (automation engine)
- OpenAI (personalization + intelligence)
- Apollo/ZoomInfo (prospect data)
- Calendly/Cal (meeting scheduling)
- Stripe (payment processing)
- Airtable/Sheets (CRM backbone)

advanced integrations scale the entire operation but don't spend too much time on the tools, focus on finding new leads

(16) and these tools mean nothing without proper monitoring...

track these metrics obsessively:
- conversion tracking at each stage
- A/B testing on all messaging
- deliverability monitoring
- response sentiment analysis
- ROI calculation per sequence

data drives decisions... not gut feelings

(17) here's the thing nobody talks about...

this isn't "set it and forget it" automation... it's "set it and optimize it weekly" automation

difference between amateurs and pros:
- amateurs build workflows once
- pros iterate workflows constantly based on performance data

weekly optimization is non-negotiable, especially when you're starting

your base system can get 10x better with data and feedback, work on it every week

(18) your weekly optimization ritual should include:

- review conversion rates at each stage
- A/B test underperforming sequences
- update personalization based on successful conversations
- adjust timing based on response patterns
- refine targeting based on closed deals

continuous improvement = continuous revenue

(19) the bottom line:

most people use n8n to save time... great entrepreneurs use n8n to make money

the automations that matter aren't the ones that eliminate busy work... they're the ones that eliminate revenue leaks

while others automate their calendars, you'll automate your customer acquisition

(20) stop collecting prompts and new workflows

start working on your f*cking outreach, get better at sales and marketing

get in calls with leads, understand why your approach is not working

twist it, rework it, change your targets...

this is a daily job of improving/reworking a system until it becomes a cash machine

(21) that's it for this thread

follow @EXM7777 for more

and if you're serious about learning AI...

subscribe for free: https://t.co/KcCY4jJBSd

engage with the post below:

- review request automation 48 hours post-completion

speed is the killer in local services

(3) moving to e-commerce brands ($1M-$10M revenue)...

they're drowning in customer service tickets while profit margins evaporate

60% of support tickets are repeat questions that kill team productivity

most brands hire their way out... smart builders automate their way out

(4) this e-commerce automation eliminates the support chaos:

- AI-powered ticket classification using OpenAI + sentiment analysis
- instant responses for order status, shipping, returns
- automatic refund processing for qualifying cases
- escalation triggers for high-value customers
- upsell automation during positive support interactions

you can get up to 70% reduction in support workload without a doubt

(5) the third goldmine is early-stage SaaS companies...

they're burning $200K+ on sales team overhead while conversion rates stay flat

80% of qualified leads never get proper follow-up because sales reps focus on "bigger" opportunities

founders think they need more salespeople... they need better automation

(6) this SaaS automation stack converts prospects on autopilot:

- product usage tracking with behavioral scoring
- triggered email sequences based on feature adoption
- automated demo booking with calendar optimization
- objection-handling chatbot with human handoff triggers
- pricing experiment automation with dynamic offer testing

you can get SO MUCH more out of those leads, they're missing out on big money

(7) now... once you've built these workflows, you need clients to buy them

here's the daily lead machine that generates 5-15 qualified leads using psychological triggers that feel personal at scale

context-driven outreach gets 25%+ response rates

anything else is sh*t

(8) but first, you need intel on your prospects...

this research layer separates you from every other n8n seller:

- prospect identification engine with ICP criteria matching
- company news + recent hires + funding events enrichment
- LinkedIn activity scraping for trigger events
- technology stack analysis for pain points
- competitor analysis for positioning opportunities

context = conversion

spend time investing in data collection for your persona, it will pay off

(9) once you have the intel, here's how to turn it into conversations

this 7-day sequence works because it builds trust before asking for anything:

day 1: insight bomb (pure value, no pitch)
day 3: pattern share (industry trend + mini case study)
day 5: resource drop (helpful tool/framework)
day 7: soft ask (low-pressure meeting request)

magic happens between day 3-5

just send this sequence in volume, there is no way you're not generating leads

(10) but getting interest is only half the battle...

most automation stops at "interested prospect", this closing protocol turns interest into contracts:

4-step sequence:
1. discovery intensifier
2. custom solution reveal
3. objection anticipator
4. decision forcer

eliminate "thinking about it" forever

execute this and you will convert every cold prospect into a customer

(11) step 1 is crucial - the discovery intensifier...

send a questionnaire that:
- uncovers specific pain points and quantifies impact
- identifies decision-making process and timeline
- establishes budget parameters without asking directly
- creates urgency through cost-of-inaction calculations

automated follow-up if not completed within 48 hours

(12) every objection should trigger an automated response...

example: "need to think about it"
--> automated response: "what specific aspect needs clarity..."
--> follow-up: case study addressing exact concern
--> escalation: personal video addressing hesitation

no leads slip through cracks when you automate objection handling

(13) after the initial close attempt, this follow-up matrix keeps you top of mind:

week 1: education phase (case studies + ROI calculators)
week 2: social proof phase (testimonials + before/after metrics)
week 3: urgency phase (limited slots + bonus offers)
week 4: final phase ("last chance" + quarterly nurture)

decision point triggers determine next action

(14) throughout this entire process, these psychological triggers do the heavy lifting:

- pattern interrupt: "you're absolutely right to think that..."
- authority transfer: "our most successful clients initially had the same concern..."
- future pacing: "imagine 6 months from now when this problem is solved..."
- loss aversion: "cost of waiting typically exceeds implementation cost by 3x..."

psychology > perfect scripts

(15) running all of this requires the right tech foundation...

core tools:
- n8n (automation engine)
- OpenAI (personalization + intelligence)
- Apollo/ZoomInfo (prospect data)
- Calendly/Cal (meeting scheduling)
- Stripe (payment processing)
- Airtable/Sheets (CRM backbone)

advanced integrations scale the entire operation but don't spend too much time on the tools, focus on finding new leads

(16) and these tools mean nothing without proper monitoring...

track these metrics obsessively:
- conversion tracking at each stage
- A/B testing on all messaging
- deliverability monitoring
- response sentiment analysis
- ROI calculation per sequence

data drives decisions... not gut feelings

(17) here's the thing nobody talks about...

this isn't "set it and forget it" automation... it's "set it and optimize it weekly" automation

difference between amateurs and pros:
- amateurs build workflows once
- pros iterate workflows constantly based on performance data

weekly optimization is non-negotiable, especially when you're starting

your base system can get 10x better with data and feedback, work on it every week

(18) your weekly optimization ritual should include:

- review conversion rates at each stage
- A/B test underperforming sequences
- update personalization based on successful conversations
- adjust timing based on response patterns
- refine targeting based on closed deals

continuous improvement = continuous revenue

(19) the bottom line:

most people use n8n to save time... great entrepreneurs use n8n to make money

the automations that matter aren't the ones that eliminate busy work... they're the ones that eliminate revenue leaks

while others automate their calendars, you'll automate your customer acquisition

(20) stop collecting prompts and new workflows

start working on your f*cking outreach, get better at sales and marketing

get in calls with leads, understand why your approach is not working

twist it, rework it, change your targets...

this is a daily job of improving/reworking a system until it becomes a cash machine

(21) that's it for this thread

follow @EXM7777 for more

and if you're serious about learning AI...

I just sent out this week's "5 freeCodeCamp resources worth your time" 🏗️. Some heaters in here including a 2-hour course on agentic "vibe coding" with n8n and a soil moisture Arduino project.

1. freeCodeCamp just published this comprehensive course that will teach you how to build apps using the LAMP Stack – Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP. This is a classic toolchain that a huge number of websites still use to this day. You can code along at home and build your own clone of Google Calendar – complete with multi-appointment support and booking conflict logic. Then you'll use JavaScript to add a dynamic user interface. This project will help you expand your horizons and get in some serious reps. (3 hour YouTube course): https://t.co/jnnOwXDWTh

2. You may have heard the term “vibe coding”, where you write the specifications for your app, then hand it over to code generation agents who write the code for you. This approach has been a bit polarizing in the developer community, with vocal critics and vocal advocates. My advice is don't listen to any of them. Think for yourself. freeCodeCamp just published this course that will introduce you to vibe coding tools like n8n – an open source workflow automation tool – so you can wire together APIs and services without needing to write a ton of code manually. (2 hour YouTube course): https://t.co/13mWijnYmg

3. On this week's podcast I interview Joe Hill. He's a software engineer who works on a data platform for NASA. Joe taught himself programming for 4 years while working as a janitor. As the single father of two Autistic boys, he first used his programming skills to build an iPad app to help them learn how to talk. He shares tons of practical tips for learning new skills and for getting things done inside big orgs. (1 hour watch or listen in your favorite podcast app): https://t.co/oxl8ZItGZV

4. Learn how to write Python tests so you can make your codebase more robust. This tutorial will teach you the basics of pytest and show you tons of examples. You'll learn about Markers, Fixtures, Parameterization, and more. (20 minute read): https://t.co/a3yi9SY3zJ

5. Tell your gardener friends: freeCodeCamp just published a tutorial on how to monitor the moisture of your soil using an Arduino microcontroller. This tutorial will show you what hardware to get and how to wire it up. Then it'll walk you through the code you'll run, and explain how everything works. (30 minute read): https://t.co/QLWSxd6a9N

The freeCodeCamp community is working hard to bring you new courses each week on pretty much everything. If you want to help our charity create even more open source learning resources, you should support our mission directly: https://t.co/PJXlqTfPxH

Quote of the Week: 
“Becoming tool agnostic is one of the biggest strengths you will ever have as a programmer. If you walk into a place and they say “we use XYZ”, you can go “Great. I'll learn it.” That is so powerful.” — Software Engineer Joe Hill on this week's freeCodeCamp podcast

Newgen is a classic example where a product gets into a higher orbit once it achieves the critical mass. It has very clearly repositioned itself from the edge of business to "at the core". 

There are many process automation tools available - both enterprise & non-enterprise. N8N being most popular in non-enterprise space and then within enterprise software, OEMs have their own process automation platforms. 

Where companies like Newgen gets the edge is not with the tech, but the years of insights of how to use underlying data and where to provision embedded AI capabilities. Launching agentic services becomes as easy as adding 2+2 eventually. All the hard-work that was done between 2020-2023 has culminated into something that has its own standing. Those who could envision ahead in time are the winners!! What a winner.
